Our team of 600 people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously


🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches


⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality


⭐ CTO Founder Associate Internship ⭐

The position is open for an immediate starting date, for a six-month internship.

CTO Founder Associates support the CTO and Senior Alaners on top business priorities, such as unlocking new growth, driving alignment on strategy and building new processes/standards internally and externally. It is a unique chance to work on many tasks in a different and non traditional environment.


You will be highly involved in key challenges for Alan, and will be asked to support high added value tasks for Alan.

 
⭐ Detailed missions ⭐

As such, you can’t be exhaustive on the missions you will perform as a CTO FA, as you can be asked to help on almost any subject. 
Possible projects include:

  • Tech: Exploring new technologies and their applications for Alan

  • Artificial Intelligence: Implementing internal solutions that leverage AI to optimize processes

  • Strategy: Contributing to company vision, market analysis, and growth modelling

  • Product: Identifying and exploring strategic opportunities

  • Corporate & Governance: Supporting board packs, legal research, and public affairs

  • Brand & Communication: Developing corporate presence at events and on social media

  • Growth: Coordinating RFPs, supporting marketing and partnerships

  • Recurring tasks: Coordinating the weekly internal communication, supporting the CTO with his weekly social posts, organizing the monthly event gathering all the Alaners, recruiting the next batch of FAs.

  • And many more...

⭐ Key Outcomes ⭐

By the end of the internship period, the intern will have:

  • Created new processes and resources, and contributed innovative ideas to improve Founders Associates team efficiency and autonomy

  • Gained skills to start your own company as a CTO

  • Met incredibly talented and smart people

  • Collaborated with the CTO and other Senior Alaners

  • Interacted with most of Alan’s communities (Engineers, Product, Strategy, Sales, Marketing, Talent)

  • Gained a 360 view of Alan

  • Contributed to at least one strategic company project (new product launch, AI model implementation, etc.).

⭐ Profile & competencies ⭐

  • Analytical sense and critical thinking: FAs possess strong abilities to frame the right questions, objectively analyze problems, and simulate possible outcomes.

  • Business and product sense: FAs need excellent understanding to think at the company level, assess cross-cutting impacts, and make sound decisions in ambiguous situations.

  • Execution and collaboration: The ability to orchestrate and direct people towards objectives is key, given the scope and timeline of work.

  • Versatility and education: given the scope of work, FAs should be able to jump from one topic to another with similar impact.

  • Organization, time management and autonomy: FAs must excel in managing projects precisely and reliably with minimal external assistance.

  • Effective communication: FAs interact with numerous Alaners daily, and therefore need to clearly express their needs, and inspire action in others.

  • Always looking for the extra mile: FAs are expected to deliver tasks quickly and well while proactively proposing new initiatives and anticipating future needs.

  • Growth mindset: you know how to ask for and receive feedback in order to grow as an FA in your early professional life.

  • Fluency in spoken and written English. All our communications are written and in English.

🙌   Perks & Benefits


At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers. 
Therefore, we offer:

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.


🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously


🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches


⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ Your mission ⭐️

Join our Enterprise Sales team as a Senior Enterprise Business Development Representative and take ownership of our very large accounts and most strategic prospects (3,000+ employees)!
This is a prospection-focused role where you'll actively identify, research, and engage senior executives at very large organizations. You'll own the entire top-of-funnel process - from strategic account mapping to relationship building - while coordinating our structured approach to penetrating complex enterprise accounts.


As a prospection specialist, you'll combine traditional BDR activities with strategic account coordination, using creative business approaches to break into hard-to-reach organizations and generate consistent pipeline for our Account Executives.

You will be responsible for 6 Key Dimensions:

🎯 Prospection

Execute multichannel approaches generating 1-2 high-quality meetings per week for Very Large accounts (3k+ employees) by applying our Smart & Soft selling methodology, to ensure prospect experience aligns with Alan's customer experience standards.

📈 Pipeline Management

Manage complex, long-cycle prospects and support Account Executives through the entire sales process, including meeting preparation and strategy development.

🤝 Executive Program Ownership

Lead Alan’s Executive Program, whereby we leverage our most Senior leads to connect with C-levels at Very Large companies. The scope involves collaborating directly with our Senior leadership to build and nurture their prospection pipe, and leverage their brand & personality to support acquisition.

📋 Tender Preparation & Influence

Support Account Executives in complex tender preparation: Collect insights from a wide range of internal stakeholders and support the tender team to package those into a compelling sales argument.

🚀 Strategic Initiatives

Actively participate in BDR team projects, contribute to sales playbook development, and take ownership of initiatives that improve team performance and processes.

💡 Nurturing Strategy Development

Proactively nurture and engage key stakeholders throughout long sales cycles - maintaining regular contact and building trust until an opportunity is opened. Leverage events, creative marketing initiatives, and the Executive Program to keep prospects engaged. Consistent follow-up is essential to develop a strong, qualified pipeline.

If you want to know more about how our Sales team works: it's here (in French)!

⭐️ Join the Sales team! ⭐️

You will be a good fit for the Senior Enterprise BDR role if you:

  • Have 3-4 years professional experience, demonstrated senior posture and strategic thinking capabilities

  • Possess executive-level communication: strong written & verbal communication skills (French native & English proficiency)

  • Demonstrate high ownership mindset: Take initiative beyond assigned tasks, break conventional approaches, and drive results through creative problem-solving

  • Have strategic prospection skills: Appetite for enterprise accounts, multichannel prospecting, and complex sales cycles management.

  • Show strategic networking skills: Strong internal relationship building, ability to leverage company resources, and navigate complex organizational structures

  • Have project management capabilities: Coordinate cross-functional initiatives, mentor team members, and contribute to strategic planning

  • Are a relationship building and nurturing mastery

  • Have the ability to collaborate in a fast-paced team

  • Have a desire to learn fast and make an impact from day 1

  • You are based in (or willing to relocate to) either Paris or Bordeaux

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire from B1 level range.

Everything else is a plus. We care about having a diversity of experiences and backgrounds in our team.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ in Paris or sponsored co-working hub in Bordeaux.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - ****it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

You'll focus on the Large segment (Tech, HCR, Retail, B2B), developing strategic prospection approaches and building relationships with senior stakeholders to fuel Alan's growth.

You will be responsible for:

  • Strategic Account Mapping: Deep analysis of target companies (300-3k employees), identifying key contacts and decision-makers across your assigned segments.

  • Quality Prospection: Execute multichannel outreach to book 2-3 high-quality discovery meetings per week through email, LinkedIn, phone, and creative approaches.

  • Understanding and applying the Alan Smart & Soft selling method to ensure prospect experience aligns with Alan's customer experience standards.

  • Meeting Preparation & Support: Preparing meeting materials, actively contributing to meetings with Account Executives, and occasionally leading meetings with non C-level contacts.

  • Relationship Building: Proactively nurture and engage key stakeholders throughout long sales cycles - maintaining regular contact and building trust until an opportunity is opened. Consistent follow-up is essential to develop a strong, qualified pipeline.

  • Contribute and Own Strategic Team Initiatives: Actively participate in BDR team projects, contribute to sales playbook development, and take ownership of initiatives that improve team performance and processes.

If you want to know more about how our Sales team works: it's here (in French)!

⭐️ Join the Sales team! ⭐️

You will be a good fit to join the Sales team at Alan if you:

  • Have min. 2 years professional experience (not necessarily pure sales background - we value analytical minds and versatility)

  • Have strong written & verbal communication skills (French native & English)

  • Have strategic prospection skills: Appetite for enterprise accounts, multichannel prospecting, and complex sales cycles

  • Demonstrate analytical excellence: strong strategic thinking, account mapping, and problem-solving abilities

  • Show confidence and resilience: Not easily intimidated, comfortable with heavy workload, and maintains positive attitude through challenges

  • Are highly organized with excellent follow-up skills and CRM proficiency

  • Possess growth mindset: Coachable, curious, and eager to master new tools including AI prospection technology

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the B1-C0 level range.

Everything else is a plus. We care about having a diversity of experiences and backgrounds in our team.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ in Paris or sponsored co-working hub in Bordeaux.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - ****it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents.

jobs.title: Founding Engineer (x/f/m) - Santé au travail
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 What is “Santé au travail”

You. Better. With Alan.

At Alan, we're reimagining occupational health (”médecine du travail”) in France. Today, this system is at risk: employees see mandatory health visits as pointless bureaucracy, HR admins struggle with services that add mental load without delivering value, and occupational health practitioners lack the tools and time to focus on real prevention. Meanwhile, critical issues like work-related mental health, musculoskeletal disorders, and burnout continue to grow.

🚀 Our vision

We're building Prévenir, a new kind of occupational health service that puts employees first. Our mission is to make occupational health a trusted partner that people actually turn to when they have work-related health concerns—not just a legal obligation they endure once every few years.

⛰️ Our ambition is to position the product as the leading fully integrated health partner for members and companies.

You’ll work side by side with experienced team members (Arnaud, Mickaël, Alexandre, Clémence, and more) to build the platform from 0 to 1, helping us craft the foundations of a product we expect to be a major breakthrough in how companies care for their employees’ health at work. You can learn more about it here.

⭐ Is it you we’re looking for?

We seek engineers driven to shape the future of workplace health services by building high-standard and innovative products.

You have the opportunity to make a significant impact:

  • You will be able to work on high-impact projects in fast-paced environments, motivated by the desire to make a difference.

  • You'll craft the perfect experience, powered by AI, simplifying the journey that significantly impacts members' health and empowering doctors to provide optimal care.

  • You'll design efficient, secure systems to ensure the integrity of sensitive medical data.

  • You'll have the chance to shape product and technical direction, collaborating with stakeholders like product teams, doctors, and operations.

You're the perfect fit if most of this sounds like you:

  • Passionate about creating delightful products with exceptional user experiences.

  • Open to working with TypeScript and Python in a cross-platform environment, familiar with modern web technologies.

  • Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time.

  • Self-starting and entrepreneurial mindset.

  • Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

  • Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority).

  • Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

Important note: we hire people not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

You want to know more about Alan?

  • 🙌 Perks & Benefits: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

  • 🤘 A strong culture: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

🔄 A quick note about the process

You're applying for a specific area, but you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organisation, depending on where we believe you'll have the most impact.

You’ll work side by side with experienced team members (Arnaud https://www.linkedin.com/in/arnaud-pioli-951b3691/, Mickaël https://www.linkedin.com/in/mickaelbergem/, Alexandre https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexandredubreuil/, Clémence, https://fr.linkedin.com/in/clemence-collon-79527330 and more) to build the platform from 0 to 1, helping us craft the foundations of a product we expect to be a major breakthrough in how companies care for their employees’ health at work. You can learn more about it here https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/building-healthcare-software-actually-matters-why-im-excited-bergem-2azoe.


⭐ IS IT YOU WE’RE LOOKING FOR?

We seek engineers driven to shape the future of workplace health services by building high-standard and innovative products.


YOU HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT:

 - You will be able to work on high-impact projects in fast-paced environments, motivated by the desire to make a difference.

 - You'll craft the perfect experience, powered by AI, simplifying the journey that significantly impacts members' health and empowering doctors to provide optimal care.

 - You'll design efficient, secure systems to ensure the integrity of sensitive medical data.

 - You'll have the chance to shape product and technical direction, collaborating with stakeholders like product teams, doctors, and operations.


YOU'RE THE PERFECT FIT IF MOST OF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU:

 - Passionate about creating delightful products with exceptional user experiences.

 - Open to working with TypeScript and Python in a cross-platform environment, familiar with modern web technologies.

 - Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time.

 - Self-starting and entrepreneurial mindset.

 - Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

 - Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority).

 - Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.


YOU WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT ALAN?

 - 🙌 Perks & Benefits https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

 - 🤘 A strong culture https://alan.com/en/about/a/leadership-principles: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

🔄 A quick note about the process

You're applying for a specific area, but you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organisation, depending on where we believe you'll have the most impact.

jobs.title: Mobile Software Engineer (x/f/m) - Tech Foundations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35,000+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 880K members, and have reached €650M+ in ARR.

Our team of 650+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

  1. Mission is the Boss: We have a mission-first focus with long-term thinking, where all employees act as owners seeking the company's success above all else.

  2. Member & Customer-led: We are obsessively focused on solving customer problems and creating delightful experiences while building trust.

  3. Excellence like Athletes: We maintain high standards and talent density, using the Keeper Test to ensure exceptional performance.

  4. Enlightened Despots: We combine distributed ownership with accountability, empowering decision-makers while maintaining responsibility.

  5. Radically Transparent: We make information accessible and written-first, promoting async communication while protecting sensitive data.

  6. Kind, Methodic Optimists: We collaborate genuinely without ego, support teammates, and maintain positive intent while assuming the best.

  7. Empathetic Challengers: We give direct feedback with empathy, praise strengths, and focus on growth through candid communication.

  8. Bold & Creative Contrarians: We think differently to achieve greatness, challenge expertise with first principles, and embrace calculated risks.

  9. Disciplined Executors: We focus on making good decisions quickly, maintain accountability, and break down problems into manageable pieces.

  10. Fight for Simplicity: We eliminate unnecessary processes, stay concise and articulate, and maintain smart frugality while solving problems pragmatically.

⭐ The Engineering team ⭐

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is React, React Native, Expo, Python/Flask PostgreSQL.

Want to know more? Read this article if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article on our Engineering career path.

🤖 The Tech Foundations area

🎯 Mission: Tech Foundations enables Product Crews to experiment and ship product increments quickly, fostering product quality and reliability with security as a nonnegotiable attribute.

🔭 Scope:

  1. Developer productivity enhancements (e.g. local environment setup, monorepo tooling, custom CLI and dashboards ...)

  2. Design and development unification (e.g. Design System, ...)

  3. Infrastructure enablement for product crews (e.g. hosting improvements, CI/CD, ...)

  4. Security and compliance facilitation (e.g. authentication, database anonymization...)

👀 Focus for 2025:

(You can learn about some of the things we did in 2024 in this blogpost)

In 2025, we will grow the team significantly to further increase our impact. We want to improve the quality of our foundations, from Infrastructure to code foundations (mobile/frontend/backend). We also have ambitions around our Security stack (authentication in particular) and enhanced tools and processes for developers.

⭐ Is it you we’re looking for?

We are looking for Mobile Software Engineers with 2+ years of mobile development experience to help us build world-class mobile experiences for our 880K+ members.

  • You'll develop and maintain our Expo applications serving members across iOS and Android.

  • You'll optimize mobile performance, user experience, and offline capabilities.

  • You'll contribute to our mobile platform foundations and development practices.

  • You'll collaborate closely with designers and product teams to implement pixel-perfect, delightful mobile experiences.

  • You’ll have the opportunity to mentor other engineers & lead crews (more details in this article).

  • You’ll be able to contribute to hiring your future coworkers and shape candidates’ hiring experience (improving our technical assessment process etc...)

You would be a good fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:

  • You have strong experience with React Native (2+ years preferred) or native mobile development with willingness to work with React Native and Expo.

  • You understand iOS and Android platform specifics and mobile app deployments processes

  • You have experience building member/consumer-facing mobile applications at scale.

  • You're comfortable with JavaScript/TypeScript and React ecosystem. Experience with native module development (Objective-C/Swift for iOS, Java/Kotlin for Android) is a plus.

  • You understand mobile performance optimization and can implement platform-specific solutions when needed.

  • You're familiar with mobile testing frameworks and debugging tools.

  • Self-starting and entrepreneurial.

  • Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).

  • Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

  • Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the C1-F level range.

But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

jobs.title: Product Engineer (x/f/m) - Claims Management
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 The mission & impact

You. Better. With Alan. We're building the insurance infrastructure that 700K+ people depend on across France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

🚀 What you'll build and who you'll work with

You would join the team called “Claims Management”, in charge of refunding €350M+ of healthcare expenses every year to 1M+ members across France, Belgium, Spain, and Canada.

Our mission is to refund each member as fast as we can and the right amount, while being cost-effective for Alan.

We have internalized all the critical parts to handle health claims, which makes this product division a technical, deep, and exciting place to work.

Claims Management contains several product crews, notably:

  • Document processing: 2M documents received every year. We automatically parse a good portion of them with LLMs but we want to go further.

  • Claims experience: Building the most memorable and straightforward experience for our members to understand their guarantees and get a claim refunded. Across 4 different countries, mobile and desktop.

  • Payments: Building a payment infra & source ingestion system to make sure our members get refunded super fast or better, they don’t need to advance the money.

  • Fraud fighting: 4M€ saved in 2024 with an internal stack combining Machine learning scoring, anomaly detections, and manual investigations

⭐ Is it you we’re looking for?

We are looking for engineers with 3+ years of experience who get excited about building complex systems that need to work perfectly 24/7 every day of the year despite being on a high-growth trajectory.

We value:

  • Passionate about creating delightful products with exceptional user experiences, you understand what it takes to build delightful user experiences at scale.

  • Good experience building and shipping web applications

  • You're genuinely interested in the business side - understanding conversion funnels, marketing metrics, and what drives growth

  • Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time.

  • Open to working with TypeScript and Python in a cross-platform environment, familiar with modern web technologies, and proficient in Object-Oriented Programming (Python, Java, Swift, Kotlin, or C#).

  • Self-starting and entrepreneurial.

  • Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).

  • Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

  • English working proficiency

Mission Alignment:

  • Healthcare technology excites you

  • Leveraging AI to redefine our roles and unlock scalability

⭐ The Engineering team ⭐

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is React, Python/Flask, PostgreSQL in a monorepo. We deploy daily and believe in distributed ownership - you build it, you own it.

Want to know more? Read this article if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article on our Engineering career path.


🌍 How we work

Location: You must be legally eligible to work in France, Belgium, or Spain.

Remote work: We offer remote work flexibility, but we value in-person collaboration

🎯 Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply, as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist. We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor pages for more info.

You want to know more about Alan?

  • 🙌 Perks & Benefits: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

  • 🤘 A strong culture: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

Note: While you're applying for the Claims Management team, you may join a different engineering team based on where we think you'll have the most impact.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (x/f/m) - Medical Software
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 What is the Medical Software

You. Better. With Alan.

At Alan, we believe healthcare should be personal, accessible, and focused on keeping people healthy—not just treating them when they're sick. Yet today's healthcare system falls short: it's impersonal, complex to navigate, and primarily reactive rather than preventive.

The Clinic crew is on a mission to change this. We're building Alan's Clinic—a comprehensive health services platform that connects members with a diverse team of health professionals (therapists, doctors, physiotherapists, and more) who provide personalised, immediate care through chat and video consultations.

As a Software Engineer on the Clinic crew, you'll be working on services that directly impact thousands of members' health journeys every day. You'll build the member experience, the operations stack that empowers our health professionals, and the underlying clinic platform that makes it all possible.

⭐ Is it you we’re looking for?

We seek engineers eager to develop our advanced telemedicine product and scale our product from various perspectives.

You have the opportunity to make a significant impact:

The Clinic is a landmark of the Alan Health experience and a key emotional differentiating point for our customers. Your work will help:

  • 💙 Make healthcare personal: Develop tools that empower health professionals to offer empathetic, tailored, and efficient support, leveraging AI to support each member's unique story.

  • 🌱 Scale preventive care: Develop the platform infrastructure that allows us to proactively support members in staying healthy.

  • 🔒 Secured by design: Navigate complex healthcare regulations and compliance requirements while maintaining Alan's renowned high-quality, secure, human-centred experience.

  • 🌎 Worldwide: Working on a product impacted members in many countries.

You’ll have the opportunity to influence the product direction, mentor other engineers & lead technical initiatives that shape the future of healthcare access (more details in this article).

You're the perfect fit if you have:

  • Member-facing product expertise - you understand what it takes to build delightful user experiences at scale

  • Open to working with TypeScript and Python in a cross-platform environment, familiar with modern web technologies, and proficient in Object-Oriented Programming using Python, Java, Swift, Kotlin, and C#.

  • Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time.

  • Humble and still willing to grow.

  • Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

What makes you stand out:

  • Experience building digital health products in a fast-paced environment

  • Mobile development experience (React Native) - our members live on mobile

Important note: we hire people not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

  • 🤘 A strong culture: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

🔄 A quick note about the process

You're applying for a specific area, but you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organisation, depending on where we believe you'll have the most impact.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
🎯 WHAT IS THE MEDICAL SOFTWARE

You. Better. With Alan.

At Alan, we believe healthcare should be personal, accessible, and focused on keeping people healthy—not just treating them when they're sick. Yet today's healthcare system falls short: it's impersonal, complex to navigate, and primarily reactive rather than preventive.

The Clinic crew is on a mission to change this. We're building Alan's Clinic—a comprehensive health services platform that connects members with a diverse team of health professionals (therapists, doctors, physiotherapists, and more) who provide personalised, immediate care through chat and video consultations.

As a Software Engineer on the Clinic crew, you'll be working on services that directly impact thousands of members' health journeys every day. You'll build the member experience, the operations stack that empowers our health professionals, and the underlying clinic platform that makes it all possible.


⭐ IS IT YOU WE’RE LOOKING FOR?

We seek engineers eager to develop our advanced telemedicine product and scale our product from various perspectives.


YOU HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT:

The Clinic is a landmark of the Alan Health experience and a key emotional differentiating point for our customers. Your work will help:

 - 💙 Make healthcare personal: Develop tools that empower health professionals to offer empathetic, tailored, and efficient support, leveraging AI to support each member's unique story.

 - 🌱 Scale preventive care: Develop the platform infrastructure that allows us to proactively support members in staying healthy.

 - 🔒 Secured by design: Navigate complex healthcare regulations and compliance requirements while maintaining Alan's renowned high-quality, secure, human-centred experience.

 - 🌎 Worldwide: Working on a product impacted members in many countries.

You’ll have the opportunity to influence the product direction, mentor other engineers & lead technical initiatives that shape the future of healthcare access (more details in this article https://blog.alan.com/tech-et-produit/engineering-organisation-at-alan).


YOU'RE THE PERFECT FIT IF YOU HAVE:

 - Member-facing product expertise - you understand what it takes to build delightful user experiences at scale

 - Open to working with TypeScript and Python in a cross-platform environment, familiar with modern web technologies, and proficient in Object-Oriented Programming using Python, Java, Swift, Kotlin, and C#.

 - Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time.

 - Humble and still willing to grow.

 - Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

What makes you stand out:

 - Experience building digital health products in a fast-paced environment

 - Mobile development experience (React Native) - our members live on mobile


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.


YOU WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT ALAN?

 - 🙌 Perks & Benefits https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

 - 🤘 A strong culture https://alan.com/en/about/a/leadership-principles: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

🔄 A quick note about the process

You're applying for a specific area, but you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organisation, depending on where we believe you'll have the most impact.

jobs.title: Product Engineer (x/f/m) - Canada 🇨🇦
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

At Alan we are on an important mission to empower everyone to live a longer, healthier life. Our goal is to extend the quality years of life expectancy for everyone.

We are empowering our members to live a longer and healthier life with a ‘one-stop health partner’ model seamlessly integrating insurance, prevention, affordable care access and well-being services. We are redefining healthcare by being both a health insurer and a provider, creating the most member-centric experience in a vast market. We go above and beyond for our members and companies to overcome the day-to-day health obstacles and our product is built to address the biggest pain points they face. With Alan, you’re never alone!

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

  1. Mission is the Boss: We have a mission-first focus with long-term thinking, where all employees act as owners seeking the company's success above all else.

  2. Member & Customer-led: We are obsessively focused on solving customer problems and creating delightful experiences while building trust.

  3. Excellence like Athletes: We maintain high standards and talent density, using the Keeper Test to ensure exceptional performance.

  4. Enlightened Despots: We combine distributed ownership with accountability, empowering decision-makers while maintaining responsibility.

  5. Radically Transparent: We make information accessible and written-first, promoting async communication while protecting sensitive data.

  6. Kind, Methodic Optimists: We collaborate genuinely without ego, support teammates, and maintain positive intent while assuming the best.

  7. Empathetic Challengers: We give direct feedback with empathy, praise strengths, and focus on growth through candid communication.

  8. Bold & Creative Contrarians: We think differently to achieve greatness, challenge expertise with first principles, and embrace calculated risks.

  9. Disciplined Executors: We focus on making good decisions quickly, maintain accountability, and break down problems into manageable pieces.

  10. Fight for Simplicity: We eliminate unnecessary processes, stay concise and articulate, and maintain smart frugality while solving problems pragmatically.


⭐️ The Engineering team ⭐️

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!
Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!
Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is Python/Flask, React/Redux, React Native, PostgreSQL.
Want to know more? Read this article if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan looks like, and how our Engineering team is organized: https://blog.alan.com/tech-et-produit/engineering-organisation-at-alan

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the C1-E level range.


⭐️ Is it you we’re looking for? ⭐️

We are looking for engineers with 3+ years of experience to help us scale our Engineering community from different perspectives (product, tech, and internal organization-wise):

  • You’ll be able to tackle high-impact & high-risk projects involving many engineers.

  • You'll design efficient systems and engineering practices to align with and facilitate interactions between multiple teams/products.

  • You’ll have the opportunity to mentor other engineers & lead crews (more details in this article).

  • You'll be able to contribute to hiring your future coworkers and shape candidates' hiring experience (improving our technical assessment process etc...)

You would be a good fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:

  • Well-versed in Object-Oriented Programming such as Python, Java, C#, and enthusiastic about web technologies such as modern JavaScript.

  • Willing to work in Python/JavaScript (but you don't need to have experience with those 2 languages!).

  • Passionate about building products.

  • Self-starting and entrepreneurial.

  • Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).

  • Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

  • Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.
For more details on how engineers can grow at Alan, take a look at our Engineering career path: https://medium.com/alan/engineering-career-path-at-alan-e5de5c2e740c

At Alan, we're committed to bringing holistic health into everyone's daily life - and that starts with our employees. We want to empower our Alaners with benefits and perks selected to ensure well-being, boost productivity, and foster a harmonious work-life balance.

Therefore, we will offer:

  • All the tools you need: MacBook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible leave policy: we trust Alaners to take the holidays they need, and no pre-approval is required.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: great benefits until we launch our own Alan Canada plans.

  • GRRSP. Generous employer matching program

  • Transport: monthly Toronto Transit Commission pass or other equivalent commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities: a highly flexible training policy, free books and budgets to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Parental leave: extended parental leave for all new parents.

You can find more information about our perks, salary, and equity here.

jobs.title: Product Engineer (x/f/m) - Growth & Brand
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 The mission & impact

You. Better. With Alan.

We're the growth engine behind Alan's self-serve member acquisition. Our systems directly convert prospects into members through self-service flows and fuel our sales teams with qualified leads for enterprise deals.

We're critical to Alan's growth - powering the marketing tools and content distribution systems that every Alaner uses to share Alan's story across the web.

Your code directly determines how fast Alan grows. Every optimization you ship means more people get access to better healthcare.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🚀 What you'll build and who you'll work with

  • Website: Build and optimize alan.com - the high-traffic platform where millions discover Alan and convert into members across all our markets.

  • Marketing Engine: Power up all our acquisition channels (paid, seo, llm etc...) that drive organic and paid traffic at scale. Keep pace with marketing trends and scale campaigns across France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

  • Self-Serve Flow: Develop seamless conversion experiences that let prospects become members instantly - from discovery, quote to final signup.

  • We also support broader business initiatives, including partnership integrations, accountant tools, referral systems, and brand campaigns that strengthen Alan's market position.

You'll actively collaborate with Marketing, Sales, Research and Product (Eng, Data, PM, Design)

⚡ Why this role is special

  • Dual impact: You'll work at the intersection of business and product - building systems that drive revenue while crafting user experiences that people love.

  • Measurable results: Every change you make has clear, trackable impact. Close feedback loops mean you know immediately when your optimizations work, creating a continuous cycle of improvement.

  • Product mindset: Our self-serve flows aren't just marketing tools - they're products we iterate on using research, data analytics, and user observation to constantly improve conversion and experience.

  • Beyond marketing: The infrastructure you build gets reused across Alan - our website systems power legal pages, RFP responses, product launches, and support the onboarding of 100K+ employees companies.

  • Direct business impact: Your code directly drives member acquisition and revenue growth while enabling teams across Alan to execute faster and better.

⭐ Is it you we’re looking for?

We are looking for engineers with 3+ years of experience who get excited about turning growth challenges and marketing complexity into simple, member-first experiences

We value:

  • Passionate about creating delightful products with exceptional user experiences, you understand what it takes to build delightful user experiences at scale.

  • Good experience building and shipping web applications

  • You're genuinely interested in the business side - understanding conversion funnels, marketing metrics, and what drives growth

  • Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time.

  • Open to working with TypeScript and Python in a cross-platform environment, familiar with modern web technologies, and proficient in Object-Oriented Programming (Python, Java, Swift, Kotlin, or C#).

  • Self-starting and entrepreneurial.

  • Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).

  • Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

  • English working proficiency

Mission Alignment:

  • Healthcare technology excites you

  • Leveraging AI to redefine our roles and unlock scalability

  • You understand that insurance isn't just about money - it's about access to care

⭐ The Engineering team ⭐

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is React, Python/Flask, PostgreSQL in a monorepo. We deploy daily and believe in distributed ownership - you build it, you own it.

Want to know more? Read this article if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article on our Engineering career path.

🌍 How we work

Location: You must be legally eligible to work in France, Belgium, or Spain.

Remote work: We offer remote work flexibility, but we value in-person collaboration and are looking for people who want to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers turn health benefits from a cost center into their most valuable investment.

🎯 Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply, as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist. We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor pages for more info.

You want to know more about Alan?

  • 🙌 Perks & Benefits: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

  • 🤘 A strong culture: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

Note: While you're applying for the Growth & Brand team, you may join a different engineering team based on where we think you'll have the most impact.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer (x/f/m) - Tech Foundations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.


🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously


🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches


⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐ The Engineering team ⭐

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is Python/Flask, React, React Native, PostgreSQL.

Want to know more? Read this article if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article on our Engineering career path.

🤖 The Tech Foundations area

🎯 Mission: Tech Foundations enables Product Crews to experiment and ship product increments quickly, fostering product quality and reliability with security as a nonnegotiable attribute.

🔭 Scope:

  1. Infrastructure enablement for product crews (e.g. hosting improvements, CI/CD, ...)

  2. Security and compliance facilitation (e.g. authentication, database anonymization...)

  3. Developer productivity enhancements (e.g. local environment setup, monorepo tooling, custom CLI and dashboards ...)

  4. Design and development unification (e.g. Design System, ...)

👀 Focus for 2025:

(You can learn about some of the things we did in 2024 in this blogpost)

In 2025, we will grow the team significantly to further increase our impact. We want to improve the quality of our foundations, from Infrastructure to code foundations (backend/frontend/mobile). We also have ambitions around our Security stack (authentication in particular) and enhanced tools and processes for developers.

🔄 A quick note about the process:

While you’re applying for a particular area, please note that you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organization, depending on where we believe you will have the most impact.

⭐ Is it you we’re looking for?

We are looking for Platform Engineers with 3+ years of experience to help us maintain high reliability while scaling our infrastructure:

  • You’ll be able to tackle high-impact & high-risk projects involving many engineers.

  • You'll design and implement robust infrastructure systems with a focus on reliability and observability.

  • You'll maintain our uptime targets while optimizing infrastructure costs.

  • You'll improve our incident management processes and lead post-mortems.

  • You'll build and maintain internal tooling (e.g. API, web interface, internal command line, ...) for other engineers.

  • You’ll have the opportunity to mentor other engineers & lead crews (more details in this article).

  • You’ll be able to contribute to hiring your future coworkers and shape candidates’ hiring experience (improving our technical assessment process etc...)

You would be a good fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:

  • You have strong experience with cloud platforms (especially AWS).

  • You have experience with monitoring, alerting, and observability tools.

  • You're comfortable writing code for automation and tooling (e.g. API, internal command line, ...).

  • You have some experience as a Full-Stack or Backend software engineer

  • Willing to work in Python/JavaScript (but you don’t need to have experience with those 2 languages!).

  • You understand modern deployment practices and CI/CD.

  • You're able to debug complex system issues.

  • Self-starting and entrepreneurial.

  • Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).

  • Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

  • Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the D-F level range.

But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.

🙌   Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers. 

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your  time as you  wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly  flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents.

Important note: we hire people not roles. 

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
🐼 WHO WE ARE

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.


🤘 HOW WE DO IT ?

People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values https://alan.com/about/company-culture that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.


🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously


🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches


⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality


⭐ THE ENGINEERING TEAM ⭐

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is Python/Flask, React, React Native, PostgreSQL.

Want to know more? Read this article https://blog.alan.com/tech-et-produit/engineering-organisation-at-alan if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article https://medium.com/alan/engineering-career-path-at-alan-e5de5c2e740c on our Engineering career path.


🤖 THE TECH FOUNDATIONS AREA

🎯 Mission: Tech Foundations enables Product Crews to experiment and ship product increments quickly, fostering product quality and reliability with security as a nonnegotiable attribute.

🔭 Scope:

 1. Infrastructure enablement for product crews (e.g. hosting improvements https://www.qovery.com/case-study/alan-case-study/, CI/CD https://medium.com/alan/moving-our-ci-cd-to-github-actions-40df3f7e4733, ...)

 2. Security and compliance facilitation (e.g. authentication, database anonymization...)

 3. Developer productivity enhancements (e.g. local environment setup https://medium.com/alan/our-journey-from-react-native-to-expo-for-mobile-app-development-at-alan-%EF%B8%8F-3b1569e8ab7c, monorepo tooling https://medium.com/alan/building-debug-tooling-for-engineers-and-support-teams-alike-34cab315b9cc, custom CLI and dashboards ...)

 4. Design and development unification (e.g. Design System https://medium.com/alan/towards-a-universal-design-system-dc4a65e1e13d, ...)

👀 Focus for 2025:

(You can learn about some of the things we did in 2024 in this blogpost) https://medium.com/alan/what-is-the-state-of-alans-developer-experience-and-what-we-are-working-on-3fc62797467f

In 2025, we will grow the team significantly to further increase our impact. We want to improve the quality of our foundations, from Infrastructure to code foundations (backend/frontend/mobile). We also have ambitions around our Security stack (authentication in particular) and enhanced tools and processes for developers.

🔄 A quick note about the process:

While you’re applying for a particular area, please note that you may ultimately join a different part of our engineering organization, depending on where we believe you will have the most impact.


⭐ IS IT YOU WE’RE LOOKING FOR?

We are looking for Platform Engineers with 3+ years of experience to help us maintain high reliability while scaling our infrastructure:

 - You’ll be able to tackle high-impact & high-risk projects involving many engineers.

 - You'll design and implement robust infrastructure systems with a focus on reliability and observability.

 - You'll maintain our uptime targets while optimizing infrastructure costs.

 - You'll improve our incident management processes and lead post-mortems.

 - You'll build and maintain internal tooling (e.g. API, web interface, internal command line, ...) for other engineers.

 - You’ll have the opportunity to mentor other engineers & lead crews (more details in this article https://blog.alan.com/tech-et-produit/engineering-organisation-at-alan).

 - You’ll be able to contribute to hiring your future coworkers and shape candidates’ hiring experience (improving our technical assessment process etc...)

You would be a good fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:

 - You have strong experience with cloud platforms (especially AWS).

 - You have experience with monitoring, alerting, and observability tools.

 - You're comfortable writing code for automation and tooling (e.g. API, internal command line, ...).

 - You have some experience as a Full-Stack or Backend software engineer

 - Willing to work in Python/JavaScript (but you don’t need to have experience with those 2 languages!).

 - You understand modern deployment practices and CI/CD.

 - You're able to debug complex system issues.

 - Self-starting and entrepreneurial.

 - Humble and still willing to grow (no matter your seniority!).

 - Collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork, learning, and teaching.

 - Fluent in English (no need to speak French!).

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the D-F level range.

But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.


🙌   PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers. 

Therefore, we offer:

 - Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary.

 - Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

 - All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your  time as you  wish.

 - Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

 - Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

 - Learning & Training opportunities. A highly  flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

 - Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents.


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE NOT ROLES. 

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.

jobs.title: Product Engineer (x/f/m) - Insurance Offer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 The mission & impact

You. Better. With Alan. We're building the insurance infrastructure that 950K+ people depend on across France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada. Our pricing system processes 1K+ quotes daily with a very high level of customization - when it breaks, people can't get healthcare coverage when they need it most.

Your code directly impacts whether someone gets healthcare coverage. In 2024, our pricing improvements boosted sales efficiency by 50% while making insurance more accessible.

🚀 What you'll build and who you’ll work with

  • Acquisition Engine: Sales teams and prospects can customize coverage, compute pricing, and generate contracts in real-time. No more waiting days for quotes.

  • Renewal System: Automatically reviews and adjusts coverage for our entire portfolio annually, accounting for legal changes, consumption trends, and economic shifts.

  • Next-Gen Pricing: We're building advanced customization that lets us tailor guarantees to individual needs while maintaining fair risk distribution.

You'll work closely with insurance experts, business analysts, and sales teams. We're the bridge between complex regulations and simple user experiences.

⚡ Why this role is special

  • Direct Impact: Your decisions affect pricing, profitability, and access to healthcare

  • Complex Problems: Multi-country regulations, real-time pricing, scale challenges

  • Ownership & Growth: Influence product direction, mentor other engineers, and lead technical initiatives that shape the future of healthcare access

🛠️ The Stack

Python/Flask, React, PostgreSQL in a monorepo. We deploy daily and believe in distributed ownership - you build it, you own it.

🔍 What we're looking for

Technical Requirements:

  • 3+ years building scalable backend systems

  • Experience with high-traffic applications that real users depend on

What we value:

  • You love turning complex problems into elegant solutions

  • You care about the "why" behind what you build, not just the "how"

  • Clear progression in your career - increasing responsibility, scope, and impact over time

Mission Alignment:

  • Healthcare technology excites you

  • You understand that insurance isn't just about money - it's about access to care

🌍 How we work

Location: You must be legally eligible to work in France, Belgium, or Spain.

Remote work: We offer remote work flexibility, but we value in-person collaboration and are looking for people who want to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers turn health benefits from a cost center into their most valuable investment.

🎯 Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply, as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist. We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor pages for more info.

You want to know more about Alan?

  • 🙌 Perks & Benefits: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

  • 🤘 A strong culture: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

Note: While you're applying for Insurance Offer, you may join a different engineering team based on where we think you'll have the most impact.
