  3. Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  1. Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

  2. Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

  3. Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  1. Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

  2. Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The Growth Marketer role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals, is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our acquisition efforts in Belgium by bringing in a dedicated growth marketing expert to accelerate our expansion in this key market 🇧🇪

You will work closely with the local acquisition referent, adapt what's working in our main market to Belgium's unique characteristics, and develop tailored strategies. You'll need to understand the Belgian healthcare landscape, cultural nuances, and what makes health insurance different in Belgium compared to other markets.

⭐ Your Mission ⭐

Your objective is to drive sustainable and scalable growth for Alan Belgium through:

  • Ownership and optimization of digital marketing channels (SEA, Meta, LinkedIn, SEO, Email marketing...)

  • Development of targeted campaigns for specific customer segments in the Belgian market

  • Design and execution of growth experiments to validate hypotheses and unlock new opportunities

  • Creation and testing of ad creatives, messaging, and landing pages that resonate with Belgian audiences

  • Data-driven optimization of campaign performance, conversion rates, and ROI

  • Collaboration with design, content, Product, and Sales teams for integrated growth initiatives

  • Management of budget allocation, performance tracking, and reporting

  • Testing and validation of new channels and tactics as growth levers

⭐ What makes this role exciting ⭐

  • Full ownership of Belgium's growth strategy and paid acquisition channels

  • Opportunity to build from the ground up—establish processes and frameworks that will scale

  • Autonomy to test and implement new strategies with real budget and impact

  • Close collaboration with cross-functional teams across Product, Sales, and Marketing

  • Direct impact on Alan's international expansion and business outcomes

  • Work with a mission-driven company transforming health insurance across Europe

  • Be part of a high-performing, innovative marketing team that's 100% in-house

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • At last 5 years in Performance Marketing, Demand Generation, Digital Marketing, or Growth Operations

  • Fluent in English

  • Fluent in French or Dutch

  • Proven track record of developing and executing successful acquisition strategies in B2B SaaS or tech companies

  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach with experience using analytics tools (Metabase, Mixpanel, etc.)

  • Experience with A/B testing, experimentation frameworks, and budget management

  • Excellent copywriting skills for ads, landing pages, and sales collateral

  • Comfortable using marketing tools: Salesforce, HubSpot, Customer.io, Figma, Webflow/Prismic

Nice-to-Have:

  • Healthcare or HR SaaS industry experience

  • Experience scaling growth in international or multi-market environments

🙌   Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers. 

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

jobs.descriptionPlain:
🐼 WHO WE ARE

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.


🤘 HOW WE DO IT ?

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values https://alan.com/about/company-culture that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

 1. Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

 2. Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

 1. Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

 2. Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

 3. Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

 1. Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

 2. Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

 3. Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

 1. Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

 2. Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality
    


⭐️ THE GROWTH MARKETER ROLE ⭐️


⭐ CONTEXT ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals, is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our acquisition efforts in Belgium by bringing in a dedicated growth marketing expert to accelerate our expansion in this key market 🇧🇪

You will work closely with the local acquisition referent, adapt what's working in our main market to Belgium's unique characteristics, and develop tailored strategies. You'll need to understand the Belgian healthcare landscape, cultural nuances, and what makes health insurance different in Belgium compared to other markets.


⭐ YOUR MISSION ⭐

Your objective is to drive sustainable and scalable growth for Alan Belgium through:

 - Ownership and optimization of digital marketing channels (SEA, Meta, LinkedIn, SEO, Email marketing...)

 - Development of targeted campaigns for specific customer segments in the Belgian market

 - Design and execution of growth experiments to validate hypotheses and unlock new opportunities

 - Creation and testing of ad creatives, messaging, and landing pages that resonate with Belgian audiences

 - Data-driven optimization of campaign performance, conversion rates, and ROI

 - Collaboration with design, content, Product, and Sales teams for integrated growth initiatives

 - Management of budget allocation, performance tracking, and reporting

 - Testing and validation of new channels and tactics as growth levers


⭐ WHAT MAKES THIS ROLE EXCITING ⭐

 - Full ownership of Belgium's growth strategy and paid acquisition channels

 - Opportunity to build from the ground up—establish processes and frameworks that will scale

 - Autonomy to test and implement new strategies with real budget and impact

 - Close collaboration with cross-functional teams across Product, Sales, and Marketing

 - Direct impact on Alan's international expansion and business outcomes

 - Work with a mission-driven company transforming health insurance across Europe

 - Be part of a high-performing, innovative marketing team that's 100% in-house


⭐ IF YOU HAVE SOME OF THE FOLLOWING, YOU MAY BE A GREAT FIT ⭐

 - At last 5 years in Performance Marketing, Demand Generation, Digital Marketing, or Growth Operations

 - Fluent in English

 - Fluent in French or Dutch

 - Proven track record of developing and executing successful acquisition strategies in B2B SaaS or tech companies

 - Strong analytical and data-driven approach with experience using analytics tools (Metabase, Mixpanel, etc.)

 - Experience with A/B testing, experimentation frameworks, and budget management

 - Excellent copywriting skills for ads, landing pages, and sales collateral

 - Comfortable using marketing tools: Salesforce, HubSpot, Customer.io http://Customer.io, Figma, Webflow/Prismic

Nice-to-Have:

 - Healthcare or HR SaaS industry experience

 - Experience scaling growth in international or multi-market environments


🙌   PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/about/life-at-alan/a/perks

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers. 

Therefore, we offer:

 - Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

 - Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

 - All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

 - Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

 - Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

 - Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture https://alan.com/en/blog/discover-alan/a/alan-culture-excellence-through-coaching.

 - Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE, NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

jobs.title: Senior Engineering Manager - AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🎯 The mission & impact

You. Better. With Alan. We're building AI-powered healthcare tools that 700K+ people depend on across France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada. Our customer support systems handle 50K+ member interactions daily with AI assistance - when they break, people can't get the healthcare guidance they need most.

Your leadership directly impacts how we deliver exceptional care to our members. In 2024, our AI-powered support tools reduced response times by 60% while improving member satisfaction scores.

🚀 What you'll build and who you'll work with

  • Support tools & systems: Sophisticated platforms that empower our support team to deliver exceptional member experiences

  • Operational solutions: Systems that combine technical excellence with a deep understanding of support workflows and member needs

  • Automated support workflows: AI-driven automation that handles routine tasks, letting our support team focus on complex member needs and relationship building

You'll lead 6-15 engineers across multiple crews, working closely with product managers, support operations, and data scientists. You're the bridge between cutting-edge AI technology and real member impact. In this role, you will:

  • Set technical direction by balancing debt with features, establishing quality standards through code reviews, and driving operational excellence in monitoring and security

  • Build talent density through strategic hiring, honest performance management, and creating engaging technical challenges that excite engineers

  • Enable effective collaboration across crews by fostering psychological safety, facilitating knowledge sharing, and addressing team dynamics proactively

  • Drive strategic alignment with product partners, improve development efficiency using modern tools (AI, Cursor, Dust), and ensure realistic commitments that balance technical needs with business goals

  • Stay hands-on with architecture decisions, technical problem-solving, and maintaining your engineering skills while developing as a leader

⚡ Why this role is special

  • Dual impact: Shape both technical excellence and team growth - your engineers become better while building better products

  • AI at scale: Lead teams building production AI systems that serve hundreds of thousands of healthcare interactions

  • Leadership growth: Influence engineering culture, mentor future leaders, and drive technical strategy that shapes the future of healthcare delivery

🔍 What we're looking for

Leadership experience:

  • 3-5 years managing engineering teams with a track record of building high-performers

  • Experience scaling teams and establishing engineering excellence standards

Technical foundations:

  • Strong technical background with ability to guide architectural decisions

  • Experience with modern development practices and AI-assisted development tools

What we value:

  • You balance technical debt with feature delivery while maintaining quality

  • You develop people as much as you develop products

  • Clear progression in your management career - increasing team size, scope, and strategic impact

Mission alignment:

  • Healthcare technology and AI innovation excite you

  • You understand that great engineering teams are built on psychological safety and continuous learning

🌍 How we work

Location: You must be legally eligible to work in France, Belgium, or Spain.

Hybrid approach: Amazing office spaces, sponsored co-working hubs, or full remote - we want you where you're most effective at leading and developing your teams.

Growth mindset: Every Alaner gets a dedicated coach from day one. As a leader, you'll have additional support for developing your management skills.

🎯 Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply, as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist. We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Internship (6 months)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan. We're building the insurance infrastructure that 950k+ people depend on across France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada and we have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

⭐️ The Engineering team ⭐️

In our engineering team, we build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our members, health professionals, and even ourselves!

Being an engineer at Alan means joining a team of talented, committed and passionate engineers, with a lot of product interaction.

We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems!

Our process is very simple: those who make product decisions are the same ones who build them.

Our stack is Python/Flask, React, React Native, PostgreSQL.

Want to know more? Read this article if you want to discover how life as an Engineer at Alan and this article on our Engineering career path.


⭐️ Is it you we’re looking for? ⭐️

Please note that for this internship, you need to be based in Paris, France, and currently enrolled in your last year of a Master's degree in a university.

You would be a great fit at Alan if most of this sounds like you:

  • You are looking for your 6-month end-of-studies internship and can start in February 2026.

  • You have prior internship or side-projects coding experience, and have already deployed frontend and backend code to production for real users

  • You are willing to work in Python/JavaScript (but you don't need to have experience with those 2 languages!)

  • You are passionate about building products

  • You are self-starting and humble

  • You are collaborative, enthusiastic about teamwork and learning

  • Fluent in English (no need to speak French!)

But above all, we are looking for high potential and curiosity: make sure to show us this when you apply! Everything else is a bonus.

If you want to learn how engineers can grow at Alan, take a look at our Engineering career path.

For this internship, we are hiring at the A2 level of our salary grid.


🎯 Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply, as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist. We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor pages for more info.



You want to know more about Alan?

  • 🙌 Perks & Benefits: Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

  • 🤘 A strong culture: People joining Alan are often surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work

⭐ The CRO Associate role⭐

CRO’s Associates support the chief revenue officer to achieve the company’s objectives on growth, sales efficiency, and go-to-market strategy.

Concretely, you will support, own, and/or lead key strategic go-to-market projects, enhancing sales efficiency, expanding our network with key prospects and clients, and driving significant growth initiatives, depending on the top priorities in the companies and the need to add more support or ownership to handpicked strategic initiatives.

The scope of intervention is very wide, and will offer an exceptional visibility to numerous parts of the go-to-market plan.

⭐ Your Responsibilities ⭐

Missions will depend on the agenda of the company, and will vary over time. You will intervene during a few months on a topic to own it, or accelerate it. . Your missions will span multiple strategic areas, some examples below:

  • Revenue Operations & Analytics - Build sophisticated forecasting models, create executive dashboards, and drive data-driven insights across all markets

  • Go-to-Market Strategy - Support market expansion initiatives, coordinate product launches, and drive cross-functional GTM alignment

  • Sales Excellence & Enablement - Design and implement sales processes, develop playbooks for different segments, create training programs, standardize methodologies

  • Strategic Planning & Execution - Coordinate business reviews with country leads and drive special revenue projects for the CRO

  • Partnership & Growth Initiatives - Support strategic partnership development, evaluate new revenue streams, and drive growth experiments

In this position, you will get a comprehensive view of revenue operations at scale and work directly with senior revenue leaders on initiatives that are instrumental to Alan's expansion.

⭐ Profile & competencies ⭐

  • Operations Expertise: Strong analytical skills (Excel / Gsheet).

  • Communication & Influence: Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

  • Commercial Acumen: Understanding of B2B/B2C sales processes, customer lifecycle management, and go-to-market strategies.

  • Cross-functional Leadership: Proven ability to coordinate complex projects across Sales, Marketing, Product, and Finance teams.

  • Strategic Thinking: Capability to work at both strategic level and detailed execution level.

  • Growth Mindset: Proactive approach to identifying opportunities, solving problems, and proposing innovative solutions. Comfortable with ambiguity and rapid iteration in a high-growth environment.

  • Fluency in spoken and written French and English. All our communications are written and in English. Additional European languages (Spanish and Dutch) are highly valued.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

⭐ THE CRO ASSOCIATE ROLE⭐

Concretely, you will support, own, and/or lead key strategic go-to-market projects, enhancing sales efficiency, expanding our network with key prospects and clients, and driving significant growth initiatives, depending on the top priorities in the companies and the need to add more support or ownership to handpicked strategic initiatives.

The scope of intervention is very wide, and will offer an exceptional visibility to numerous parts of the go-to-market plan.


⭐ YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES ⭐

Missions will depend on the agenda of the company, and will vary over time. You will intervene during a few months on a topic to own it, or accelerate it. . Your missions will span multiple strategic areas, some examples below:

 - Revenue Operations & Analytics - Build sophisticated forecasting models, create executive dashboards, and drive data-driven insights across all markets

 - Go-to-Market Strategy - Support market expansion initiatives, coordinate product launches, and drive cross-functional GTM alignment

 - Sales Excellence & Enablement - Design and implement sales processes, develop playbooks for different segments, create training programs, standardize methodologies

 - Strategic Planning & Execution - Coordinate business reviews with country leads and drive special revenue projects for the CRO

 - Partnership & Growth Initiatives - Support strategic partnership development, evaluate new revenue streams, and drive growth experiments

In this position, you will get a comprehensive view of revenue operations at scale and work directly with senior revenue leaders on initiatives that are instrumental to Alan's expansion.


⭐ PROFILE & COMPETENCIES ⭐

 - Operations Expertise: Strong analytical skills (Excel / Gsheet).

 - Communication & Influence: Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.

 - Commercial Acumen: Understanding of B2B/B2C sales processes, customer lifecycle management, and go-to-market strategies.

 - Cross-functional Leadership: Proven ability to coordinate complex projects across Sales, Marketing, Product, and Finance teams.

 - Strategic Thinking: Capability to work at both strategic level and detailed execution level.

 - Growth Mindset: Proactive approach to identifying opportunities, solving problems, and proposing innovative solutions. Comfortable with ambiguity and rapid iteration in a high-growth environment.

 - Fluency in spoken and written French and English. All our communications are written and in English. Additional European languages (Spanish and Dutch) are highly valued.


🙌 PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/about/life-at-alan/a/perks

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

 - Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

 - Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

 - All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

 - Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

 - Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

 - Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture https://alan.com/en/blog/discover-alan/a/alan-culture-excellence-through-coaching.

 - Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE, NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.

#LI-DNI

jobs.title: Operations Coordinator - Spanish Market
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  1. Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

  2. Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  1. Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

  2. Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

  3. Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  1. Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

  2. Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

  3. Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  1. Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

  2. Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ Operations at Alan

The Operations Community’s core responsibilities is to deliver at scale our insurance and health services : we build our platform and operational capabilities and run our processes to guarantee delight and efficiency.

As we anchor our Insurance position, diversify our offering with health and well-being related services in 4 different countries (France, Belgium, Spain and Canada), our operations are increasingly complex and our challenges ahead have never been as exciting!

Being an Ops at Alan means joining a team of 50+ talented, committed and passionate Ops across our countries, with a lot of interactions with Engineering, Product, Care and many other teams at Alan.

We have a mix of Builder profiles, focused on (re)designing and implementing our processes and Operations Coordinators who deliver those on a daily basis while improving them.

We want team members to deliver excellence to our companies and members and be ready to disrupt (and not only upgrade) the way we traditionally think about insurance or healthcare services.

🌍 For this role, you need to be based in Spain 🌍

The Operations Coordinator works on a specific subset of services we deliver (eg. claim reimbursement, fraud, clinic to name a few) .

Their core responsibilities (+- 70/80% of the time) are to:

  • Run our Insurance or Health services processes - that's why we call them Ops Runners internally 😉

  • Ensure the day-to-day follow up and monitoring of our operations

  • Flag risks and opportunities

In details, your missions are:

  • Operating our processes: performing tasks like invoicing or claims treatment, growing and managing our network of providers, supporting internal teams (live and through documentation)

  • Contributing to the definition & owning the best monitoring scheme to track volumes/efficiency/SLAs, and identify risks and areas of improvement, internally or with our service providers

  • Supervising partnerships (e.g. teleconsultation, claim operators), participating in the negotiation rounds, daily communication to ensure business continuity

  • Performing controls on our daily operations to make sure the correct decisions were made and to identify training needs (internally as well as externally)

  • Escalating feedback, helping to prioritise and supporting initiatives to make our processes and services more delightful and efficient

Next to running and monitoring our operations, you implement continuous improvements to our processes (+-20/30% of the time). This can be in a variety of ways, e.g. working with product teams to automate certain processes, enhancing our external communication, auditing our processes, automating some process steps using automation tools, …

⭐️ Our Run organisation ⭐️

Our Operations Coordinators or Ops Runners are organized in pools (3-7 runners) who are collectively responsible for running their scope. Examples of topics are:

Alan therapy: members can book a therapy session with psychologists. You maintain smooth relationships with our psychologists, ensure therapy demand  matches the supply and contribute to several steps of their lifecycle at Alan (hiring, onboarding, invoicing, supporting booking management etc).

Claims: We provide a best-in-class claims experience, including our own optic care service. You treat claims and assist in decisions regarding our coverage. Additionally, you monitor the performance of external service providers to meet SLAs & perform quality controls. You ensure glasses get delivered on time, member satisfaction is high, our frame collection is attractive, collaboration with opticians is smooth and efficient, ….

Fraud: We run checks on claims submitted by our members, and build new ways of preventing fraud attempts. You investigate suspicious claims, prevent fraudulent payments or recover when we paid fraudulent claims.

Set up:  We provide best-in-class experience to our Customers : a smooth on/offboarding of their employees and a seamless invoicing or billing. To do so, we continuously control & improve the quality of our processes : ensuring we have consistent information for invoicing, unlocking employee invite/removals in case of issue and supporting admin in case of payment issue or bankruptcy.

Note: We look for profiles able to embrace any challenge and jump in any pool ! Depending on Alan needs (and personal interests), an Operations Coordinator will join in a pool and  can change and explore new scopes after some time. Do not hesitate to ask more concrete examples to the Operations Team Members you’ll meet during the process so they can share about their own scope.

⭐️ Experience ⭐️

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the A2-B level range.

Since the scope of our Ops Runner role is extremely varied, we are open to candidates from different backgrounds : you could be a good fit for the Operations team at Alan if, for example, you:

  • Operated processes and services especially for companies during the scale up stage or in industrial/logistic industries

  • Worked in Support functions (Customer Support, People Operations etc)

  • Had a Customer facing Commercial experience, e.g. account manager or Customer Success Communications, such as Social Media, Internal/ External Communications

  • Handled event coordination

⭐️ Skills ⭐️

  • Passionate about delivering & optimizing top notch operations: not scared to get your hands dirty to get into technical processes, making them clear and delightful for our operators and members

  • A keen problem-solver and challenger with a dig deep mindset: what drives you is member and customer satisfaction !

  • Highly organised with exceptional follow-up skills, with strong attention to details

  • Strong and structured in written and verbal communication in English as well as in French (level C1 and above), with a high empathy

  • Able to work and learn independently in a fast-paced environment

  • Adaptable: you show flexibility and a strong ability to adapt to variable situations

  • It’s even better if you have:

    • Experience in the insurance or the healthcare industry

    • Some analytics skills, to be able to dive into our data

🙌  Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

jobs.title: Operations Coordinator - Canadian Market

🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

We want team members to deliver excellence to our companies and members and be ready to disrupt (and not only upgrade) the way we traditionally think about insurance or healthcare services.

⭐️ The operations coordinator role ⭐️

The Operations Coordinator works on a specific subset of services we deliver (eg. claim reimbursement, fraud, clinic to name a few).

Their core responsibilities (+- 70/80% of the time) are to:

  • Run our Health Insurance processes - that's why we call them Ops Runners internally 😉

  • Ensure the day-to-day monitoring of our ops and tackle bottlenecks before they develop

  • Flag opportunities to make our experience more delightful for members and admins

  • Callout risks and come with a plan to mitigate them

In detail, your missions will encompass:

  • Operating our Insurance processes: Handling member claims, refining our understanding of complex cases and implementing new benefits plans for customers

  • Contributing to the definition & owning the best monitoring scheme to track volumes/efficiency/SLAs, and identify risks and areas of improvement, internally or with our service providers

  • Manage the monthly billing process for all Alan Canada customers

  • Escalating feedback, helping to prioritise and supporting initiatives to make our processes and services more delightful and efficient

Next to running and monitoring our operations, you implement continuous improvements to our processes (+-20/30% of the time). This can be in a variety of ways, e.g. working with product teams to automate certain processes, enhancing our external communication, auditing our processes, automating some process steps using automation tools, etc.

⭐️ Experience ⭐️

Since the scope of our Ops Runner role is extremely varied, we are open to candidates from different backgrounds : you could be a good fit for the Operations team at Alan if, for example, you:

  • Had a Customer facing Commercial experience, e.g. account manager or Customer Success Communications, such as Social Media, Internal/ External Communications

  • Handled event coordination

⭐️ Skills ⭐️

  • Passionate about delivering & optimizing top notch operations: not scared to get your hands dirty to get into technical processes, making them clear and delightful for our operators and members

  • A keen problem-solver and challenger with a dig deep mindset: what drives you is member and customer satisfaction !

  • Highly organised with exceptional follow-up skills, with strong attention to details

  • Strong and structured in written and verbal communication in English as well as in French (level C1 and above), with a high empathy

  • Able to work and learn independently in a fast-paced environment

  • Adaptable: you show flexibility and a strong ability to adapt to variable situations

  • It’s even better if you have:

    • Experience in the insurance or the healthcare industry

    • Some analytics skills, to be able to dive into our data

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the A2-B1 level range.

Why joining us now?

  • Unique opportunity to contribute to the launch of a global healthcare player in Canada

  • Provide a meaningful generational change to Canadians healthcare experiences

  • Grow a business in a new country from 0-1

  • Best balance of scrappy and thriving start-up environment while being part of a fluid global powerhouse

  • The chance to be part of the founding team in Canada

🙌 Perks & Benefits

  • In office: amazing office space right in the heart of the financial district (King & Yonge) to work closely and collaboratively with your colleagues 4-5 days per week in-person!

  • All the tools you need: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible leave policy: we trust Alaners to take the holidays they need, and no pre-approval is required.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: great benefits through Alan’s Canada app!

  • GRRSP. Generous employer matching program!

  • Transport: monthly Toronto Transit Commission pass or other equivalent commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities: a highly flexible training policy, free books and budgets to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

🐼 WHO WE ARE

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.


🤘 HOW WE DO IT ?

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values https://alan.com/about/company-culture that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

 1. Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

 2. Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

 1. Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

 2. Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

 3. Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

 1. Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

 2. Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

 3. Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

 1. Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

 2. Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality


⭐️ OPERATIONS AT ALAN ⭐️

The Operations Community’s core responsibilities is to deliver at scale our insurance and health services: we build our platform and operational capabilities and run our processes to guarantee delight and efficiency.

Being an Ops at Alan means joining a team of 50+ talented, committed and passionate Ops across our countries, with a lot of interactions with Engineering, Product, Care and many other teams at Alan.

We have a mix of Builder profiles, focused on (re)designing and implementing our processes and Operations Coordinators who deliver those on a daily basis while improving them.

We want team members to deliver excellence to our companies and members and be ready to disrupt (and not only upgrade) the way we traditionally think about insurance or healthcare services.


⭐️ THE OPERATIONS COORDINATOR ROLE ⭐️

The Operations Coordinator works on a specific subset of services we deliver (eg. claim reimbursement, fraud, clinic to name a few).

Their core responsibilities (+- 70/80% of the time) are to:

 - Run our Health Insurance processes - that's why we call them Ops Runners internally 😉

 - Ensure the day-to-day monitoring of our ops and tackle bottlenecks before they develop

 - Flag opportunities to make our experience more delightful for members and admins

 - Callout risks and come with a plan to mitigate them

In detail, your missions will encompass:

 - Operating our Insurance processes: Handling member claims, refining our understanding of complex cases and implementing new benefits plans for customers

 - Contributing to the definition & owning the best monitoring scheme to track volumes/efficiency/SLAs, and identify risks and areas of improvement, internally or with our service providers

 - Manage the monthly billing process for all Alan Canada customers

 - Escalating feedback, helping to prioritise and supporting initiatives to make our processes and services more delightful and efficient

Next to running and monitoring our operations, you implement continuous improvements to our processes (+-20/30% of the time). This can be in a variety of ways, e.g. working with product teams to automate certain processes, enhancing our external communication, auditing our processes, automating some process steps using automation tools, etc.


⭐️ EXPERIENCE ⭐️

Since the scope of our Ops Runner role is extremely varied, we are open to candidates from different backgrounds : you could be a good fit for the Operations team at Alan if, for example, you:

 - Operated processes and services especially for companies during the scale up stage or in industrial/logistic industries

 - Worked in Support functions (Customer Support, People Operations etc)

 - Had a Customer facing Commercial experience, e.g. account manager or Customer Success Communications, such as Social Media, Internal/ External Communications

 - Handled event coordination


⭐️ SKILLS ⭐️

 - Passionate about delivering & optimizing top notch operations: not scared to get your hands dirty to get into technical processes, making them clear and delightful for our operators and members

 - A keen problem-solver and challenger with a dig deep mindset: what drives you is member and customer satisfaction !

 - Highly organised with exceptional follow-up skills, with strong attention to details

 - Strong and structured in written and verbal communication in English as well as in French (level C1 and above), with a high empathy

 - Able to work and learn independently in a fast-paced environment

 - Adaptable: you show flexibility and a strong ability to adapt to variable situations

 - It’s even better if you have:
   
   - Experience in the insurance or the healthcare industry
   
   - Some analytics skills, to be able to dive into our data

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the A2-B1 level range https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity.


WHY JOINING US NOW?

 - Unique opportunity to contribute to the launch of a global healthcare player in Canada

 - Provide a meaningful generational change to Canadians healthcare experiences

 - Grow a business in a new country from 0-1

 - Best balance of scrappy and thriving start-up environment while being part of a fluid global powerhouse

 - The chance to be part of the founding team in Canada


🙌 PERKS & BENEFITS https://alan.com/en/careers/a/salary-equity

 - In office: amazing office space right in the heart of the financial district (King & Yonge) to work closely and collaboratively with your colleagues 4-5 days per week in-person!

 - All the tools you need: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

 - Flexible leave policy: we trust Alaners to take the holidays they need, and no pre-approval is required.

 - Delightful healthcare insurance: great benefits through Alan’s Canada app!

 - GRRSP. Generous employer matching program!

 - Transport: monthly Toronto Transit Commission pass or other equivalent commuter benefits.

 - Learning & Training opportunities: a highly flexible training policy, free books and budgets to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

 - Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture https://alan.com/en/blog/discover-alan/a/alan-culture-excellence-through-coaching.

 - Parental leave: extended parental leave for all new parents.


IMPORTANT NOTE: WE HIRE PEOPLE, NOT ROLES.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan https://alan.com/about and Career https://alan.com/careers pages, as well as our Medium https://medium.com/alan, blog https://blog.alan.com/ and Glassdoor page https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-Alan-EI_IE1696043.11,15.htm for more info.

jobs.title: Operations Coordinator
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  1. Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

  2. Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  1. Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

  2. Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

  3. Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  1. Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

  2. Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

  3. Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  1. Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

  2. Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ Operations at Alan

The Operations Community’s core responsibilities is to deliver at scale our insurance and health services : we build our platform and operational capabilities and run our processes to guarantee delight and efficiency.

As we anchor our Insurance position, diversify our offering with health and well-being related services in 4 different countries (France, Belgium, Spain and Canada), our operations are increasingly complex and our challenges ahead have never been as exciting!

Being an Ops at Alan means joining a team of 50+ talented, committed and passionate Ops across our countries, with a lot of interactions with Engineering, Product, Care and many other teams at Alan.

We have a mix of Builder profiles, focused on (re)designing and implementing our processes and Operations Coordinators who deliver those on a daily basis while improving them.

We want team members to deliver excellence to our companies and members and be ready to disrupt (and not only upgrade) the way we traditionally think about insurance or healthcare services.

🌍 For this role, you need to be based in France, Belgium or Spain 🌍

The Operations Coordinator works on a specific subset of services we deliver (eg. claim reimbursement, fraud, clinic to name a few) .

Their core responsibilities (+- 70/80% of the time) are to:

  • Run our Insurance or Health services processes - that's why we call them Ops Runners internally 😉

  • Ensure the day-to-day follow up and monitoring of our operations

  • Flag risks and opportunities

In details, your missions are:

  • Operating our processes: performing tasks like invoicing or claims treatment, growing and managing our network of providers, supporting internal teams (live and through documentation)

  • Contributing to the definition & owning the best monitoring scheme to track volumes/efficiency/SLAs, and identify risks and areas of improvement, internally or with our service providers

  • Supervising partnerships (e.g. teleconsultation, claim operators), participating in the negotiation rounds, daily communication to ensure business continuity

  • Performing controls on our daily operations to make sure the correct decisions were made and to identify training needs (internally as well as externally)

  • Escalating feedback, helping to prioritise and supporting initiatives to make our processes and services more delightful and efficient

Next to running and monitoring our operations, you implement continuous improvements to our processes (+-20/30% of the time). This can be in a variety of ways, e.g. working with product teams to automate certain processes, enhancing our external communication, auditing our processes, automating some process steps using automation tools, …

⭐️ Our Run organisation ⭐️

Our Operations Coordinators or Ops Runners are organized in pools (3-7 runners) who are collectively responsible for running their scope. Examples of topics are:

Alan therapy: members can book a therapy session with psychologists. You maintain smooth relationships with our psychologists, ensure therapy demand  matches the supply and contribute to several steps of their lifecycle at Alan (hiring, onboarding, invoicing, supporting booking management etc).

Claims: We provide a best-in-class claims experience, including our own optic care service. You treat claims and assist in decisions regarding our coverage. Additionally, you monitor the performance of external service providers to meet SLAs & perform quality controls. You ensure glasses get delivered on time, member satisfaction is high, our frame collection is attractive, collaboration with opticians is smooth and efficient, ….

Fraud: We run checks on claims submitted by our members, and build new ways of preventing fraud attempts. You investigate suspicious claims, prevent fraudulent payments or recover when we paid fraudulent claims.

Set up:  We provide best-in-class experience to our Customers : a smooth on/offboarding of their employees and a seamless invoicing or billing. To do so, we continuously control & improve the quality of our processes : ensuring we have consistent information for invoicing, unlocking employee invite/removals in case of issue and supporting admin in case of payment issue or bankruptcy.

Note: We look for profiles able to embrace any challenge and jump in any pool ! Depending on Alan needs (and personal interests), an Operations Coordinator will join in a pool and  can change and explore new scopes after some time. Do not hesitate to ask more concrete examples to the Operations Team Members you’ll meet during the process so they can share about their own scope.

⭐️ Experience ⭐️

For this opportunity, we are aiming to hire within the A2-B level range.

Since the scope of our Ops Runner role is extremely varied, we are open to candidates from different backgrounds : you could be a good fit for the Operations team at Alan if, for example, you:

  • Operated processes and services especially for companies during the scale up stage or in industrial/logistic industries

  • Worked in Support functions (Customer Support, People Operations etc)

  • Had a Customer facing Commercial experience, e.g. account manager or Customer Success Communications, such as Social Media, Internal/ External Communications

  • Handled event coordination

⭐️ Skills ⭐️

  • Passionate about delivering & optimizing top notch operations: not scared to get your hands dirty to get into technical processes, making them clear and delightful for our operators and members

  • A keen problem-solver and challenger with a dig deep mindset: what drives you is member and customer satisfaction !

  • Highly organised with exceptional follow-up skills, with strong attention to details

  • Strong and structured in written and verbal communication in English as well as in French (level C1 and above), with a high empathy

  • Able to work and learn independently in a fast-paced environment

  • Adaptable: you show flexibility and a strong ability to adapt to variable situations

  • It’s even better if you have:

    • Experience in the insurance or the healthcare industry

    • Some analytics skills, to be able to dive into our data

🙌  Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

jobs.title: Médecin du travail
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Qui nous sommes

Prévenir est un service de prévention et de santé au travail interentreprises (SPSTI) innovant en île-de-France.

Nous rejoindre, c'est participer à sa mise en place et être partie prenante d'un challenge ambitieux qui nécessite de la créativité et un fort intérêt pour les nouvelles technologies.

Nous construisons le service de santé au travail de la plus haute qualité en France, en nous appuyant sur :

Une équipe médicale d’excellence qui impulse le changement et innove dans la santé au travail

L’accès à des technologies clés comme l’IA grâce à un partenariat solide avec Alan, acteur majeur de la santé et de la technologie en France

Les éléments clés du service

  • Mise en oeuvre poussée de la délégation à l'équipe pluridisciplinaire et IDEST

  • Utilisation de la téléconsultation sur demande du salarié

  • Développement d'outils IA pour améliorer les pratiques en santé au travail

  • Utilisation du numérique pour créer des outils de prévention individuels et collectifs innovants

Vos responsabilités

  • Coordonner les trois missions des SPSTI sur votre périmètre d'entreprises adhérentes

  • Gestion de votre équipe pluridisciplinaire

  • Collaboration avec l'équipe opérationnelle pour le déploiement du service

  • Collaboration avec l'équipe d'ingénieurs pour le développement d'outils numériques et IA dédiés

Profil recherché

  • Requis: Doctorat en médecine et DES ou CES de médecine du travail

  • 5 ans d'expérience en santé au travail

  • Excellentes compétences en communication et capacité à établir une relation de confiance avec les salariés et les adhérents

Vous vous retrouvez dans ces quelques lignes? Envoyez nous votre candidature et nous échangerons avec plaisir !

Si l'opportunité vous intéresse mais que vous ne cochez pas toutes les cases, contactez nous. Si vous êtes une femme, savez vous que la recherche montre que les femmes ne candidatent souvent que lorsqu'elles remplissent 100% des critères ? Rappelez-vous, ceci est un guide, pas une checklist.

Autres informations

Employeur: Prévenir Santé Travail

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI

Rémunération : selon profil

Avantages:

  • Formation linguistique offerte

  • Plan d'intéressement

  • Prise en charge du transport quotidien

  • RTT

  • Restaurant d'entreprise

  • Télétravail partiel possible

 - Coordonner les trois missions des SPSTI sur votre périmètre d'entreprises adhérentes

 - Gestion de votre équipe pluridisciplinaire

 - Collaboration avec l'équipe opérationnelle pour le déploiement du service

 - Collaboration avec l'équipe d'ingénieurs pour le développement d'outils numériques et IA dédiés

Profil recherché

 - Requis: Doctorat en médecine et DES ou CES de médecine du travail

 - 5 ans d'expérience en santé au travail

 - Excellentes compétences en communication et capacité à établir une relation de confiance avec les salariés et les adhérents

Vous vous retrouvez dans ces quelques lignes? Envoyez nous votre candidature et nous échangerons avec plaisir !

Si l'opportunité vous intéresse mais que vous ne cochez pas toutes les cases, contactez nous. Si vous êtes une femme, savez vous que la recherche montre que les femmes ne candidatent souvent que lorsqu'elles remplissent 100% des critères ? Rappelez-vous, ceci est un guide, pas une checklist.




AUTRES INFORMATIONS

Employeur: Prévenir Santé Travail

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI

Rémunération : selon profil

Avantages:

 - Formation linguistique offerte

 - Plan d'intéressement

 - Prise en charge du transport quotidien

 - RTT

 - Restaurant d'entreprise

 - Télétravail partiel possible

jobs.title: Infirmier(ère) de santé au travail H/F
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Description du poste

À propos du poste
Nous recherchons un(e) IDEST passionné(e) et compétent(e) pour rejoindre notre équipe pluridisciplinaire. Vous serez en charge:

  • Des visites individuelles, en présentiel et en distanciel, sous protocole de collaboration avec le médecin du travail

  • De la mise en place d'actions de prévention individuelles, collectives pendant le tiers temps dédié

  • D'aider notre équipe de Prévenir à mettre en place les outils et procédures adaptées pour servir nos adhérents et leurs salariés

Ce poste requiert une solide connaissance en santé au travail (3 ans d'expérience minimum) ainsi qu'une capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique.

Prévenir est un nouveau service, participer à sa mise en place est un challenge excitant qui nécessite de la créativité et un intérêt important pour les nouvelles technologies.

Responsabilités

  • Assurer les visites selon les protocoles établis

  • Collaborer avec l'équipe pluridisciplinaire pour planifier et coordonner les actions et le suivi

  • Conseiller l'équipe de développement sur les procédures et outils à déployer

  • Tenir à jour les dossiers médicaux en respectant la terminologie médicale

  • Réaliser les actions de prévention en milieu professionnel

  • Participer à la gestion administrative liée au suivi

Profil recherché

  • Diplôme d'État d'infirmier(e) requis

  • Formations en santé au travail requises (DIUST, afometra...)

  • 3 ans d'expérience en santé au travail après DIUST

  • Excellentes compétences en communication et capacité à établir une relation de confiance avec les salariés et les adhérents

jobs.title: SEA Specialist - (Search, YouTube, Display)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  1. Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.

  2. Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  1. Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.

  2. Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.

  3. Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  1. Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.

  2. Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally

  3. Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  1. Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time

  2. Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The SEA Specilalist role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals (freelancers, retirees, etc.), is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our paid acquisition efforts by bringing in a dedicated expert to own and optimize one of our paid marketing channels.

⭐ Your mission ⭐

Your objective is to scale Alan's paid acquisition efforts, in order to succeed, you will:

  • Own and optimize Search, Performance Max, YouTube, and Demand Gen campaigns across all markets where we operate (France, Belgium, Spain)

  • Manage > 1M in annual SEA budget, ensuring efficient spend and strong ROI across markets

  • Test, iterate and scale holistic demand generation campaigns that align with Alan's ambitious goals and marketing OKRs

  • Collaborate with ad platform partners (Google, Microsoft, etc.) to stay at the forefront of paid trends

  • Transform pieces of content into multiple high-impact formats tailored to your channel

  • Partner with our talented performance marketers to create our next top advertising campaign, powered by AI and live shooting at the office

  • Partner within cross functional teams (Eng, Ops, Brand, Design…) in order to scale our campaigns

  • Make full use of AI and automation to maximise operational efficiencies

  • Contribute to define our strategy within the Paid Media team and work on international expansion: adapt and scale winning strategies across France, Belgium, Spain, and potentially new markets like Canada

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in paid search or paid marketing

  • Fluent in English.

  • Proficiency with Google Ads (Search, Performance Max, Display, YouTube) / Bing

  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach

  • Experience in campaign creation, optimization and budget management

  • Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of projects

  • Creative mindset with test-and-learn approach

It is a big plus if you:

  • Are able to work in French, Dutch or Spanish as a second language

  • Have a first B2B experience

  • Have some experience managing multi-market, multi-language campaigns

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.

  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.

  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.

  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.

  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).

  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.

  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.

  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.

  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.
